item.title: Harvey add a quote by Oliver Sacks
item.description: "Every act of perception, is to some degree an act of creation, and every act of memory is to some degree an act of imagination." -- Oliver Sacks

item.title: Harvey add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "I like being myself. Myself and nasty." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Harvey add a quote by Richard Brautigan
item.description: "Excuse me, I said. I thought you were a trout stream. I'm not, she said." -- Richard Brautigan

item.title: Harvey add a quote by richard brautigan
item.description: "all of us have a place in history. mine is clouds." -- richard brautigan

item.title: Harvey add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Peace is the only battle worth waging." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Harvey add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I was drawn to all the wrong things: I liked to drink, I was lazy, I didn't have a god, politics, ideas, ideals. I was settled into nothingness; a kind of non-being, and I accepted it. I didn't make for an interesting person. I didn't want to be interesting, it was too hard. What I really wanted was only a soft, hazy space to live in, and to be left alone. On the other hand, when I got drunk I screamed, went crazy, got all out of hand. One kind of behavior didn't fit the other. I didn't care." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Harvey add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Dancing is a perpendicular expression of a horizontal desire." -- George Bernard Shaw
